titleStmt.title: L. Hoglan et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4339

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his excellency Thos E. Bramlett We would respectfully state that Henry Stallings was fined thirty dollars before M. P. Heady police judge of Shepherdsville in September last for a breach of the peace we think the fine was excessive. Stallings is a poor man, and we respectfully ask your excellency to remit all of said fine except five dollars which together with the costs would be simple punishment for the offence.

L. Hoglan P. J. B. C C
John G. L. Holmesnil
Martin Bats
Michael Troutman
Sterling L Couglen
James Y Pope
Lloyd Friddle T. M. S
Isaac Moore
Wm. Chaddie
Wm R Thompson
B. F. Troutman
John C Brian
R. F Joyce
J. T. Friddle
Ch. R. Samuels
W. J. Colbow
John Richerson
W. O. Barbour
Dr. A. D. Coffee
William H. Coffee
Perry Burks
Woodford McDowell
E. H. McCormick
S. A. McKay
T L Dix
